intro: Cryptantha rostellata, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its blue or purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cryptantha rostellata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
